thread.section_title: Latest business and finance news from New Zealand and the world's key markets - Yahoo New Zealand Finance
thread.title: Boeing misses 2Q profit forecasts

title: Boeing misses 2Q profit forecasts
text:
Thu, Jul 23, 2015, 2:33 AM NZST - New Zealand Markets open in 7 hrs 27 mins Boeing misses 2Q profit forecasts AAP â€“ 1 hour 57 minutes ago Recommend 

Boeing has reported second-quarter net income of $US1.11 billion ($A1.50 billion). 
The Chicago-based company on Wednesday reported profit of $1.59 per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, were $1.62 per share. 
The results fell short of Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of five analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.71 a share. 
The plane builder posted revenue of $US24.54 billion for the period, which beat Wall Street forecasts. 
Boeing expects full-year earnings in the range of $7.70 to $7.90 per share, with revenue in the range of $US94.5 billion to $US96.5 billion. 
Boeing shares have climbed 12 per cent since the beginning of the year.
